author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN STILL A VERY LARGE HURRICANE... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS FOR A COUPLE MORE DAYS...
summary: ...ERIN STILL A VERY LARGE HURRICANE... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS FOR A COUPLE MORE DAYS... As of 11:00 AM AST Fri Aug 22 the center of Erin was located near 38.8, -63.1 with movement ENE at 28 mph. The minimum central pressure was 956 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 90 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN STILL A VERY LARGE HURRICANE... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS FOR A COUPLE MORE DAYS... As of 11:00 AM AST Fri Aug 22 the center of Erin was located near 38.8, -63.1 with movement ENE at 28 mph. The minimum central pressure was 956 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 90 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Erin (AT5/AL052025)
